verses.kjv: O ye children of Benjamin, gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and set up a sign of fire in Bethhaccerem: for evil appeareth out of the north, and great destruction.
verses.web: “Flee for safety, you children of Benjamin, out of the middle of Jerusalem! Blow the trumpet in Tekoa and raise up a signal on Beth Haccherem, for evil looks out from the north with a great destruction.
verses.ct: "Run for your lives, people of Benjamin! Get out of Jerusalem! Sound the trumpet in Tekoa and light a signal fire in Beth-haccerem, because disaster is coming from the north — terrible destruction is on its way."

verses.kjv: I have likened the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate woman.
verses.web: I will cut off the beautiful and delicate one, the daughter of Zion.
verses.ct: The beautiful and delicate daughter of Zion — I will destroy her.

verses.kjv: The shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall feed every one in his place.
verses.web: Shepherds with their flocks will come to her. They will pitch their tents against her all around. They will feed everyone in his place.”
verses.ct: Enemy kings will come against her with their armies. They'll set up camp all around her, and each one will devour whatever territory is in front of him.

verses.kjv: Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day goeth away, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
verses.web: “Prepare war against her! Arise! Let’s go up at noon. Woe to us! For the day declines, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
verses.ct: "Prepare for war against her! Let's attack at noon!" But then they say, "No — the day is slipping away, and the evening shadows are growing long."

verses.kjv: Arise, and let us go by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
verses.web: Arise! Let’s go up by night, and let’s destroy her palaces.”
verses.ct: "Then let's go up at night and tear down her fortresses!"

verses.kjv: For thus hath the LORD of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast a mount against Jerusalem: this is the city to be visited; she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.
verses.web: For LORD of Armies said, “Cut down trees, and cast up a mound against Jerusalem. This is the city to be visited. She is wholly oppression within herself.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts has given the order: "Cut down her trees and build siege ramps against Jerusalem. This is the city that must be punished — she is rotten with oppression through and through."

verses.kjv: As a fountain casteth out her waters, so she casteth out her wickedness: violence and spoil is heard in her; before me continually is grief and wounds.
verses.web: As a well produces its waters, so she produces her wickedness. Violence and destruction is heard in her. Sickness and wounds are continually before me.
verses.ct: "The way a spring keeps pouring out fresh water, Jerusalem keeps pouring out wickedness. Violence and destruction echo through her streets. Sickness and wounds are always before me."

verses.kjv: Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul depart from thee; lest I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited.
verses.web: Be instructed, Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from you, lest I make you a desolation, an uninhabited land.”
verses.ct: "Listen to this warning, Jerusalem, before my soul turns away from you — before I turn you into an empty wasteland where no one lives."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, They shall throughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer into the baskets.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says, “They will thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel like a vine. Turn again your hand as a grape gatherer into the baskets.”
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says, "They will pick through what's left of Israel the way a harvester strips every last grape from a vine. Reach back again and again into the branches like a grape gatherer filling his baskets."

verses.kjv: To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of the LORD is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.
verses.web: To whom should I speak and testify, that they may hear? Behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they can’t listen. Behold, LORD’s word has become a reproach to them. They have no delight in it.
verses.ct: But who can I even speak to? Who will listen to my warning? Their ears are closed shut — they can't hear a thing. The word of the LORD has become an insult to them. They want nothing to do with it.

verses.kjv: Therefore I am full of the fury of the LORD; I am weary with holding in: I will pour it out upon the children abroad, and upon the assembly of young men together: for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him that is full of days.
verses.web: Therefore I am full of LORD’s wrath. I am weary with holding it in. “Pour it out on the children in the street, and on the assembly of young men together; for even the husband with the wife will be taken, the aged with him who is full of days.
verses.ct: So I am filled to bursting with the LORD's fury, and I'm exhausted from holding it back. "Pour it out on the children playing in the streets and on the young men gathered together. Even husbands and wives will be swept up in it, and the elderly too — those who have lived long lives."

verses.kjv: And their houses shall be turned unto others, with their fields and wives together: for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Their houses will be turned to others, their fields and their wives together; for I will stretch out my hand on the inhabitants of the land, says LORD.”
verses.ct: "Their houses will be handed over to strangers, along with their fields and their wives, because I am raising my hand against everyone living in this land," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
verses.web: “For from their least even to their greatest, everyone is given to covetousness. From the prophet even to the priest, everyone deals falsely.
verses.ct: "Everyone is greedy for dishonest gain — from the lowest to the highest. Even the prophets and priests are frauds."

verses.kjv: They have healed also the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
verses.web: They have healed also the hurt of my people superficially, saying, ‘Peace, peace!’ when there is no peace.
verses.ct: "They treat my people's wounds as if they were nothing serious, saying, 'Everything is fine! Everything is fine!' — when nothing is fine at all."

verses.kjv: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among them that fall: at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? No, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush. Therefore they will fall among those who fall. When I visit them, they will be cast down,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Were they ashamed when they did these disgusting things? Not even a little — they didn't even know how to blush. So they will fall along with everyone else who falls. When I bring judgment on them, they will be brought down," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Stand ye in the ways, and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way, and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said, We will not walk therein.
verses.web: LORD says, “Stand in the ways and see, and ask for the old paths, ‘Where is the good way?’ and walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls. But they said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Stop at the crossroads and look around. Ask which path is the ancient, proven way — the good road — and walk on it. You'll find rest for your souls." But they said, "We refuse."

verses.kjv: Also I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not hearken.
verses.web: I set watchmen over you, saying, ‘Listen to the sound of the trumpet!’ But they said, ‘We will not listen!’
verses.ct: "I posted watchmen over you and told them, 'Listen for the trumpet's warning!' But they said, 'We won't listen.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is among them.
verses.web: Therefore hear, you nations, and know, congregation, what is among them.
verses.ct: "So listen, all you nations! Pay attention, everyone — see what is happening among these people."

verses.kjv: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened unto my words, nor to my law, but rejected it.
verses.web: Hear, earth! Behold, I will bring evil on this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not listened to my words; and as for my law, they have rejected it.
verses.ct: "Listen, earth! I am about to bring disaster on this people — the consequences of their own scheming — because they refused to listen to my words and rejected my law."

verses.kjv: To what purpose cometh there to me incense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a far country? your burnt offerings are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices sweet unto me.
verses.web: To what purpose does frankincense from Sheba come to me, and the sweet cane from a far country? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable, and your sacrifices are not pleasing to me.”
verses.ct: "What good is your frankincense imported from Sheba, or your fragrant spices shipped from distant lands? Your burnt offerings don't please me, and your sacrifices mean nothing to me."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people, and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them; the neighbour and his friend shall perish.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says, “Behold, I will lay stumbling blocks before this people. The fathers and the sons together will stumble against them. The neighbor and his friend will perish.”
verses.ct: So the LORD says, "Watch — I am placing obstacles in front of this people. Fathers and sons alike will stumble over them. Neighbors and friends will die together."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Behold, a people cometh from the north country, and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.
verses.web: LORD says, “Behold, a people comes from the north country. A great nation will be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Look — a nation is coming from the north. A mighty people is being stirred up from the far ends of the earth."

verses.kjv: They shall lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses, set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of Zion.
verses.web: They take hold of bow and spear. They are cruel, and have no mercy. Their voice roars like the sea, and they ride on horses, everyone set in array, as a man to the battle, against you, daughter of Zion.”
verses.ct: "They carry bows and spears. They are cruel and show no mercy. Their battle cry roars like the ocean. They ride on horses, lined up in formation like warriors ready for battle — and they're coming for you, daughter of Zion."

verses.kjv: We have heard the fame thereof: our hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us, and pain, as of a woman in travail.
verses.web: We have heard its report. Our hands become feeble. Anguish has taken hold of us, and pains as of a woman in labor.
verses.ct: We've heard the reports about them, and our hands go limp with fear. Anguish grips us — pain like a woman in labor.

verses.kjv: Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy and fear is on every side.
verses.web: Don’t go out into the field or walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy and terror are on every side.
verses.ct: Don't go out into the fields or walk along the roads, because the enemy's sword is everywhere, and terror surrounds us on every side.

verses.kjv: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.
verses.web: Daughter of my people, clothe yourself with sackcloth, and wallow in ashes! Mourn, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation, for the destroyer will suddenly come on us.
verses.ct: My people, put on sackcloth and roll in ashes! Mourn as bitterly as you would for an only child, because the destroyer is about to strike us without warning.

verses.kjv: I have set thee for a tower and a fortress among my people, that thou mayest know and try their way.
verses.web: “I have made you a tester of metals and a fortress among my people, that you may know and try their way.
verses.ct: "I have made you like a metal tester and a fortress among my people, so that you can examine and evaluate how they live."

verses.kjv: They are all grievous revolters, walking with slanders: they are brass and iron; they are all corrupters.
verses.web: They are all grievous rebels, going around to slander. They are bronze and iron. All of them deal corruptly.
verses.ct: "Every one of them is stubbornly rebellious, spreading slander wherever they go. They are hard as bronze and iron — all of them are corrupt."

verses.kjv: The bellows are burned, the lead is consumed of the fire; the founder melteth in vain: for the wicked are not plucked away.
verses.web: The bellows blow fiercely. The lead is consumed in the fire. In vain they go on refining, for the wicked are not plucked away.
verses.ct: "The bellows blast with fire, and the lead melts away, but the refining is pointless — the impurities can't be separated out because the wicked refuse to be purged."

verses.kjv: Reprobate silver shall men call them, because the LORD hath rejected them.
verses.web: Men will call them rejected silver, because LORD has rejected them.”
verses.ct: "People will call them 'rejected silver,' because the LORD himself has rejected them."
